NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024050784
item.description:
Report X-2024050784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. ON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW ONE PACKAGE WITH A SMALL STAIN ON THE CORNER. UPON FUTHER INSPECTION, FOUND THAT THE BOTTLES WERE SHIPPED WITH VENTED CAPS INSIDE OF PLASTIC BAGS. THE VENTED CAPS CAUSED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT DAMAGING THE BOX

item.title: Report X-2024051050
item.description:
Report X-2024051050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Camp IIunches, 042 Operations Supervisor, advised Safety of a Potassium Hydroxide Solution spill on the dock floor at Bay 171. Camp advised a dock worker was attempting to move the pallet in front of the damaged pallet and noticed it had been punctured causing the spill. Camp stated the spill appear s to be dry. Camp advised dock worker, Frederick Lentz, is who docked the pallet at Bay 171. Rosa with Cura was contacted at 2159 CT for remediation.

  • Description: It was reported that 1-gallon of Weld on fast drying cement was released from one 1-gallon metal can due to a forklift accident impacting the concrete dock and trailer floor. Prior to notifying ERTS the terminal placed the waste into a 20-gallon poly drum for disposal. No further cleanup was needed.

item.title: Report E-2024050618
item.description:
Report E-2024050618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-10ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that twenty (20) pounds of material was released due to improper loading that punctured four (4) 50-pound plastic bags. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only four (4) bags were damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bags and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
